summary: Housework could keep brain young: Even light activity such as household chores might help to keep the brain young, suggests a...
caption: Housework could keep brain young: Even light activity such as household chores might help to keep the brain young, suggests a new study (n=2,354), which found every extra hour of light physical activity per day was linked to 0.22% greater brain volume, equal to just over a year’s less brain ageing.

summary: Protective Effect of Childhood Measles Against Degenerative Diseases in Later Life
title: Protective Effect of Childhood Measles Against Degenerative Diseases in Later Life
description:
Studies showing the immunological BENEFITS of getting measles.

Protective Effect of Childhood Measles Against Degenerative Diseases in Later Life

The above study indicates that a lack of rash in measles is associated with an increased incidence of autoimmune and degenerative diseases in later life. As the rash is the means through which the toxin is expelled from the body, its absence leads to the measles virus remaining in the body. The widespread use of vaccination has led to the appearance of “atypical measles” and “mild measles” where no rash develops. This can expose children to diseases in later life.

Read more:
http://www.vaccines.me/…/afcjt-protective-effect-of…

Measles Virus Infection Without Rash In Childhood Is Related To Disease In Adult Life.
The Lancet, January 5 1985

Abstract
The presence of measles specific antibodies is usually taken as evidence of typical measles in the past; in the present study it was regarded as evidence of infection with measles virus, but not necessarily of the common disease accompanied by a typical rash. The association between a negative history of measles in childhood and certain diseases later in life was investigated by a historical prospective method, based on school health records combined with self-reporting in adulthood, and tests for specific IgG measles antibody. There was evidence of association between a negative history of measles, exposure in early life (possibly injection of immune serum globulin after exposure), and development of immunoreactive diseases, sebaceous skin diseases, degenerative diseases of bone and cartilage, and certain tumours. It is suggested that the presence of measles virus specific antibodies at the time of acute infection interferes with development of specific cytolytic reactions, and enables intracellular measles virus to survive the acute infection. If this hypothesis is verified, use of immune serum globulin after measles exposure has to be reconsidered.

http://www.thelancet.com/…/PIIS0140-6736%2885…/abstract

The Unreported Health Benefits of Measles
http://www.greenmedinfo.com/…/unreported-health…

Wild measles and mumps protects against heart problems. https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/26122188

Wild Mumps: Researchers investigated whether mumps might engender immunity to ovarian cancer through antibodies against the cancer-associated antigen MUC1 abnormally expressed in the inflamed parotid gland.
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2951028/

Wild Measles: Adults are significantly protected against non-breast cancers — genital, prostate, gastrointestinal, skin, lung, ear-nose-throat, and others — if they contracted measles earlier in life. [Med Hypotheses 1998; 51(4): 315-20].
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/m/pubmed/9824838/

Wild Measles: Montella et al found that contracting measles in childhood reduces the risk of developing lymphatic cancer in adulthood [Leuk Res 2006; 30(8): 917-22].
http://www.lrjournal.com/…/S0145-2126(05)00466-2/abstract
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/m/pubmed/16406019/

Wild Measles: Alexander et al found that infection with measles during childhood is significantly protective — it cuts the risk in half — against developing Hodgkin’s disease (OR = 0.53) [Br J Cancer 2000; 82(5): 1117-21].
http://www.nature.com/bjc/journal/v82/n5/full/6691049a.html
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/m/pubmed/10737396/

Measles to the Rescue: A Review of Oncolytic Measles Virus.
MV Clinical trials are producing encouraging preliminary results in ovarian cancer, myeloma and cutaneous non-Hodgkin lymphoma, and the outcome of currently open trials in glioblastoma multiforme, mesothelioma and squamous cell carcinoma are eagerly anticipated.
Aref S, et al. Viruses. 2016.
http://www.mdpi.com/1999-4915/8/10/294
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5086626/

Wild Measles: Glaser et al also found that lymph cancer is significantly more likely in adults who were not NATURALLY infected with measles, mumps or rubella in childhood [In J Cancer 2005; 115(4): 599-605].

Measles and childhood infections have the potential to reduce allergies:
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/9102962

“In univariate analysis, hay fever was less common in those contracting measles infection than in those not infected, and more common in those given measles vaccination than in those not vaccinated.”

Clin Exp Allergy. 1998 Dec;28(12):1493-500.
Measles infection, measles vaccination and the effect of birth order in the aetiology of hay fever.
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/10024220

The already long existing and the real study science has already long since, shown us what the REAL truth is.

Measles jab reduces inherited immunity

A recent study found that women vaccinated with the measles vaccine pass on far less immunity to their offspring than women who are not vaccinated. Measles jab reduces inherited immunity

http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/health/503025.stm

Waning of Maternal Antibodies Against Measles, Mumps, Rubella, and Varicella in Communities With Contrasting Vaccination Coverage

Conclusions. Children of mothers vaccinated against measles and, possibly, rubella have lower concentrations of maternal antibodies and lose protection by maternal antibodies at an earlier age than children of mothers in communities that oppose vaccination. This increases the risk of disease transmission in highly vaccinated populations.

http://jid.oxfordjournals.org/…/04/29/infdis.jit143.long

Why so much hysteria about 465 claimed to cases of measles, nationwide, (with no deaths and no reported disability effects) when according to the most recent US census, 22.6% of the population is under 18 years of age. That equates to 73,939,840 kids. As a percentage, that number of cases of measles is not only statistically insignificant, 465 cases of measles are absolutely inconsequential. Of that 465 number, how many were actually vaccinated or were older adults previously vaccinated but no longer have any vaccine protection?. Your state health departments seem to have great difficulty in providing that data. Why is that?

Measles cases spike to 465 nationwide in past week
04/08/19
https://thehill.com/…/437865-number-of-measles-cases…

MEASLES MADNESS: FIVE THINGS YOU NEED TO KNOW BEFORE FREAKING OUT
https://www.learntherisk.org/news/measles-madness/

summary: [QUESTION] Am I reacting to sugar now? via /r/Paleo
title: [QUESTION] Am I reacting to sugar now? via /r/Paleo
body:
I didn’t have this when I was vegan, and I’m basically mainly eating animal products now. Not sure whats happening there, but every time I eat fruit or other carbs I get this slight burning under my skin. It’s hard to describe but it’s pretty uncomfortable. I would love to know whats happening there. Obviously my body doesn’t like sugar very much, but it would be cool if someone knew the cemistry behind that. 😅



Submitted April 20, 2019 at 05:48AM by anjamoest
via reddit http://bit.ly/2GxQ9hv

Gouty arthritis is an excruciating condition that is caused by excess uric acid in the body.

summary: HCSM News ~ What happened to triclosan? A lingering legacy of the hyper-hygiene era
title: HCSM News ~ What happened to triclosan? A lingering legacy of the hyper-hygiene era
body:
A few years ago we were brushing our teeth with it, rinsing our mouths with it, sanitizing our hands with it. And now triclosan is almost vanished from the marketplace.



Read more from CBC https://www.cbc.ca/news/health/triclosan-hand-sanitizer-antibacterial-health-canada-fda-toxic-environment-1.5104614?cmp=rss

summary:
Aseem Malhotra  BOOM! 
 Remember a few weeks ago the news headlines that 8000 lives could be 
saved for elderly patients taking...
caption:
Aseem Malhotra


BOOM!
Remember a few weeks ago the news headlines that 8000 lives could be saved for elderly patients taking statins ? 

With my help it’s been exposed in today’s i newspaper that the figure was made up! 

There is NO MORTALITY benefit in over 75s who have not suffered a heart attack taking statins.

 The person making that claim was Professor Colin Baigent of the clinical trials service unit of Oxford. 

This number wasn’t even mentioned in his own analysis of biased industry sponsored research published in the Lancet. 

This a huge embarrassment for the university of Oxford and the Lancet. It’s worth noting that his department has received hundreds of millions in ‘research’ funding from drug companies manufacturing statins.

 You can read the full article here and make your own mind up on who to believe. 

 And please feel free to share widely. More to come 😉

  https://inews.co.uk/…/statins-drugs-effectiveness-academic…/
